info.description:
Package main is the entrypoint for the orderer binary
and calls only into the server.Main() function.  No other
function should be included in this package.
info.title: Orderer API

license.name: Copyright IBM Corp. All Rights Reserved.

get.summary: Returns the complete list of channels an Ordering Service Node (OSN) has joined.

post.description: If a channel does not yet exist, it will be created.
post.summary: Joins an Ordering Service Node (OSN) to a channel.

parameters.description: up-to-date config block for the channel.
parameters.name: configBlock

403.description: The client is trying to join the system-channel that does not exist, but application channels exist.

405.description:
The client is trying to join an app-channel, but the system channel exists.
The client is trying to join an app-channel that exists, but the system channel does not.
The client is trying to join the system-channel, and it exists.

409.description: The client is trying to join a channel that is currently being removed.

get.summary: Returns detailed channel information for a specific channel Ordering Service Node (OSN) has joined.

delete.summary: Removes an Ordering Service Node (OSN) from a channel.

405.description: The system channel exists, removal is not allowed.

ChannelInfoShort.title: ChannelInfoShort carries a short info of a single channel.

url.description: The channel relative URL (no Host:Port, only path), e.g.: "/participation/v1/channels/my-channel".

ConsensusRelation.title: ConsensusRelation represents the relationship between the orderer and the channel's consensus cluster.

Status.description:
Status represents the degree by which the orderer had caught up with the rest of the cluster after joining the
channel (either as a consenter or a follower).

channelInfo.description: This is marshaled into the body of the HTTP response.
channelInfo.title: ChannelInfo carries the response to an HTTP request to List a single channel.

url.description: The channel relative URL (no Host:Port, only path), e.g.: "/participation/v1/channels/my-channel".

channelList.description: This is marshaled into the body of the HTTP response.
channelList.title: ChannelList carries the response to an HTTP request to List all the channels.

channels.description: Application channels only, nil or empty if no channels defined.
